tentpoles.title: The Anomaly
tentpoles.description: Marcus discovers Voyager 2's signal ping pattern is accelerating - impossible unless the probe is decelerating toward Earth. He runs the numbers repeatedly, terrified he's wrong.

tentpoles.title: Institutional Dismissal
tentpoles.description: Marcus presents findings to observatory director and government liaison. They dismiss it as equipment error. Sofia believes him - they decide to investigate independently.

tentpoles.title: The Mathematical Test
tentpoles.description: Marcus and Yuki decode the signal - it contains a mathematical proof humanity has never discovered. Proof aliens are using Voyager to test human intelligence. They're being evaluated.

tentpoles.title: Going Dark
tentpoles.description: Kessler's agency raids the observatory. Marcus and team go underground with the data. Public leak forces government acknowledgment. World fractures into believer/denier camps.

tentpoles.title: The Choice Revealed
tentpoles.description: Final signal decoded: aliens offer humanity a binary choice - unite to accept contact, or remain divided and be left alone forever. Voyager will arrive in 12 months. Clock starts.

tentpoles.title: The Summit
tentpoles.description: UN convenes emergency global summit. Marcus invited as expert witness. Power blocs immediately begin positioning for advantage. Kessler and Thorne form alliance.

tentpoles.title: Corporate Conspiracy
tentpoles.description: Thorne's Prometheus Industries attempts to intercept Voyager with private spacecraft to monopolize alien tech. Marcus must expose the plan without destabilizing fragile international cooperation.

tentpoles.title: The Second Test
tentpoles.description: New signal reveals the test has two parts: intelligence (passed) and ethics. Aliens are watching how humanity handles the choice. Every conflict, every betrayal is being evaluated.

tentpoles.title: Fracture Point
tentpoles.description: NAU and Asian Coalition split over response strategy. Small nations demand equal voice. Violent protests erupt globally. Humanity is failing the ethics test. Marcus realizes consensus is impossible through politics.

tentpoles.title: The Grassroots Solution
tentpoles.description: Sofia proposes bypassing governments - direct global referendum through distributed network. Marcus and Yuki build the system. Kessler faces choice: suppress it or allow it. He allows it. Thorne sabotages it. Chaos.

tentpoles.title: Six Months
tentpoles.description: Voyager detected visually entering solar system. Global referendum shows 60% unity - not enough. New factions emerge: saboteurs who want to destroy Voyager, worshippers who see it as divine, scientists who want to study it.

tentpoles.title: The Weapon Option
tentpoles.description: Military faction plans to destroy Voyager before arrival. Kessler torn between duty and conscience. Marcus must convince him that violence guarantees failure of the ethics test.

tentpoles.title: Thorne's Redemption
tentpoles.description: Thorne reveals she sabotaged the referendum because she discovered a third option in the alien math: humanity can defer the choice if it demonstrates potential for growth. She's been working on proof.

tentpoles.title: Three Days
tentpoles.description: Voyager three days from Earth. Military launches strike despite orders. Thorne sacrifices her corporate empire to broadcast proof of third option. Yuki completes the mathematical proof. Marcus must present it to the world.

tentpoles.title: First Echo, Final Answer
tentpoles.description: Marcus addresses world as military strike inbound. He presents the proof - humanity is young, divided, but learning. We ask for time. Voyager intercepts the missile, disables it harmlessly, broadcasts acceptance. First contact on human terms.
